Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Aeolian Wild Goat Style pottery open vessel, probably a dinos; white slip; glaze fired orange-red; interior glazed; exterior: glazed area above band of outlined tongues.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
London Dinos Style. For parallels, see Izmir 5018 in Cook and Dupont, 1998, p. 60, fig. 8.23.
Bibliographic references: Kerschner 2006 / On the Provenance of Aiolian Pottery (p. 118, n. 12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.15)
